intro: Dasystephana cherokeensis, commonly known as Cherokee starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
